This morning we spotted new all-time lows landing on the new Samsung Galaxy Watch 8 with no trades or bundles required. You can check those deal out right here, but for folks who just don’t care about the latest and greatest, or would perhaps want to secure the last Samsung watch with a proper round case shape, Amazon’s Prime Big Deals Days is delivering a new all-time low starting from $149.99 shipped on Galaxy Watch 7.

It's an entirely different thing to watch an $1,800 phone with delicate mechanical parts sink half an inch into the sand with the screen wide open. There's more to that story, but the short version is that the Google Pixel […]

The space was fragmented, battery life was dismal, and interest just didn't seem to be there. But now, the $349.99 Google Pixel Watch 4 is the most […]

items.title: Google Pixel Buds 2A review: the right kind of compromise
items.summary: The current state of headphones is a bummer. In one sense, the market has never been so good: from Bose to Sony to Apple to Google to Samsung to Sennheiser to JBL to unpronounceable Chinese knockoffs, you can't spin around in a Best Buy without finding a pair of solid-sounding earbuds. items.title: Save up to 48% on Greenworks equipment during Prime Day, like the 4-in-1 40V 21-inch cordless mower at $315 (Reg. $450)
items.summary:
As part of the ongoing Prime Big Deal Days savings event, Amazon is offering up to 48% discounts across a large collection of Greenworks electric tools, like the 40V 21-inch Cordless Self-Propelled Lawn Mower with a 5.0Ah battery at $314.99 shipped. This is a newer mower amongst the lineup, which is coming down off its usual $450 tag for a lower price than we normally see, with things having mostly kept above $360 over the year. Things finally dropped lower for the first time during July’s Prime Day, when costs were taken down to $328, with today’s deal only beaten out by the $273 low that popped up for a short time last month. If you missed out there, you can get it here at the next-best rate, which cuts $135 off the tag and gives you a more advanced electric mowing solution. You’ll find more of the best Greenworks Prime Day tool deals below.

more…

items.title: Whoa! This 45W wall charger with built-in retractable charging cable is only $6.50 (Save 77%)
items.summary:
LISEN 45W Wall Charger with Retractable USB-C Cable

Buy for $6.50 (Reg. $28)

Clip the on-page 50% off coupon.

What we love

While wall chargers go on sale left and right these days, most of them do not have a retractable USB-C cable built right in. This one does, and even the AC prongs fold flat when not in use, making it a compact charger that’s worth dropping in your travel bag, tech bin, and more.

items.title: Nearly 90% of surveyed East Congo clinics out of medicines, Red Cross says
items.summary: October 8 (Reuters) -More than 200 health facilities in war-hit eastern Congo have run out of medicines due to widespread looting and supply chain disruptions during fighting this year, the International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC) said on Wednesday. Read full story

Apple has introduced a simple solution to the problem in iOS 26, as spotted by MacRumors, that should also work with any other pair […]

items.title: Haiti children displaced by violence nearly double in a year, UNICEF says
items.summary: PORT-AU-PRINCE (Reuters) -Spiraling violence in Haiti has displaced 680,000 children, nearly twice as many as a year ago, as armed groups tighten control and public services collapse, UNICEF said on Wednesday.  Read full story

items.title: Get Alienware’s 34-inch 180Hz Fast IPS curved gaming monitor for your battlestation while it’s $285 for Prime Day
items.summary:
As part of its ongoing Prime Big Deal Days sale, Amazon is offering Alienware’s 34-inch 180Hz WQHD curved gaming monitor for $284.99 shipped. This display hit the shelves earlier this year carrying a $400 price tag, and has mostly stuck to that price with some occasional drops to $320 to $330 range. It hit $300 for the first time yesterday at both Amazon and directly at Dell as part of its Holiday sale, but today’s Prime-exclusive offer delivers an additional $15 discount to mark a new best price to beat. This is the lowest price we have tracked for this monitor to date, and you can learn more about it below.

items.summary:
Anker 6-foot 100W USB-C Cables (5-pack)

Buy for $13.50 (Reg. $24)

Prime-exclusive discount

What we love

If you want to expand your USB-C cable collection, this is a solid time to strike. Bearing in mind that these are made by Anker, span 6 feet in length, and support up to 100W charging speeds, $2.50 each is a nice price point. I like that they are braided and rated to withstand “5,000 bends.”

A survey of US parents: 90% say their kids aged 12 or younger watch TV, 68% use a tablet, 61% use a smartphone, 50% use a gaming device, and 8% use a chatbot  —  From YouTube to smartphones to tablets, tech is part of kids' lives.  AI chatbots are part of the mix now, too.
